result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence. Release for inmate work assignments and the Day Reporting Center.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the course of probation to agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Seek/maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both.

Provide  DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.
Mental health evaluation and any recommended treatment.  Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment.

No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with any known illegal drug users, except in an AODA support meeting.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.

Notify  DOC agent of all prescriptions within three (3) days of receiving prescription from any doctor.
Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy unless otherwise approved by DOC agent and notify DOC agent of the pharmacy used.
Fine set at zero.

Participate in alcohol and drug asessment. Successfully complete recommended treatmetn including drug and alcohol testing at least two times per month for the first year.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Must attend at least one alcohol and drug assessment teatmetn or sobriety support group/meeting per week for the first year.

timeConds.notes:
No good time credit.  Release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments, AODA treatment, medical appointments, school, childcare, eldercare.  
Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
STAYED to use as if there is any violation of drug related conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety:  No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing at least 2 times per month for the first year.  
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment treatment or sobriety support group/meeting per week for the first year.  
- Defendant to notify Department of Corrections agent of all prescriptions within 3 days of receiving prescription from any Doctor.
- Fill all prescriptions at one pharmacy, unless otherwise approved by Department of Corrections Agent, and notify the Department of Corrections agent of the pharmacy used. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Seek/ Maintain fulltime employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user, except in an AODA support meeting.
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health Treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Court ordered defendant to serve 135 DAYS CONDITION TIME  in the House of Correction without goodtime credit; release for The Day Reporting Center  and inmate work assignments, AODA treatment, medical appointments, school, child care, elder care. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring  This is stayed to use as if there is any violation of drug related conditions of probation. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson not in court, in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant not produced. Defense counsel waives defendants appearance.
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned for projected Plea and Sentencing on 6-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  
Defendant Jessica Jill Newsted-Peterson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
